The Netty 4.0.56.Final and 4.1.21.Final released and fix this bug

ObjectCleanerThread must be a deamon thread to ensure the JVM can always terminate ([#7627](https://github.com/netty/netty/pull/7627))

What "counts" for the release is what we distribute in term of the tgz with the sources rather than the git repo.

Thanks @XiaoZYang for starting this!

For the FAQs I was wondering whether the wiki might be an easier way to maintain it.

There are few pros & cons for Wiki vs Repo: 
 Pros: 
  * It's easier to make quick changes
  * Multiple people can edit different questions independently without conflicts

Cons:
 * Right now, only committers have write access to wiki. We could check with INFRA with respect to this
 * There are no PRs comments

Opinions?
@sebbASF I think that finally I should have captured all the points. Thanks for explaining multiple times!
retest this please

I'm basically +1 on this, but I'm not sure `clean` is an appropriate phase. People might be confused if code was modified when they run `mvn clean`. Also, if we are going to check code format on CI, we shouldn't format code during the build. Otherwise the check wouldn't work. Maybe we should use git hook (pre-commit) instead.
:+1: we've been having issues with this
AuthenticationTls used wrong config parser (JSON). It should be fixed.

We should make the Standalone service to behave like the Proxy.

Currently, the Pulsar standalone service is a very regular Pulsar deployment, with 1 broker / 1 bookie / 1 ZK all running in the same JVM. 

The normal lookup and redirection for service discovery applies to standalone. 

If the "hostname" of the machine where the Standalone service is running is not set, or set to a name that is not in DNS or anyway reachable from other machines, the client will fail. 

The user can specify `--advertised-address 1.2.3.4` but that sometimes is difficult to diagnose, and it other cases (like dynamic container envs) difficult to set.

If we make the Standalone to force the "proxy" flag in the `Connected` response, it will make all clients to always connect through the same address they used for the initial connection, removing the need to fix the broker advertised address.

The other doubt here was which form would be preferred between: 

```java
Producer producer = client.newProducer().topic("my-topic").create();
```
versus

```java
Producer producer = client.newProducer("my-topic").create();
```

This is regarding required and optional parameters.

The 2nd is a bit more concise, though that doesn't mean a lot if you're setting multiple options anyway.

Opinions with respect to this?

@jai1  Can you take a look at this?

> so it's forcefully closing the connection after 60s

but right now, shouldn't proxy also handle client's keep-alive request on `PulsarHandler.handlePing()`  which should keep connection alive between client to proxy and same way proxy to broker?

> but right now, shouldn't proxy also handle client's keep-alive request on PulsarHandler.handlePing() which should keep connection alive between client to proxy and same way proxy to broker?

The proxy just passes along bytes at that point. The ping from client is just passed on to broker, which is the one that will respond. If there is a network partition either between client/proxy or proxy/broker, it will be identfied.
yes, once proxy state is in `ProxyConnectionToBroker` then it becomes just pass through.

Actually I was looking into the code, and found much of duplicate code.

The blocks for `trustManager` and `keyManager` really seem like `SecurityUtility::createNettySslContext`. Probably only difference is context for client vs for server.

Using `SecurityUtility` class would also remove the dependency for `org.apache.pulsar.client.impl.auth.AuthenticationDataTls`. That is what `AuthenticationDataTls` use internally.
@merlimat I have addressed your comments. can you review this again? After it looks good, I will rebase it to latest master.
I know `SecurityUtility` class itself should be refactored too but I'll do that later to make this PR simple and easy to review.
Submitted a PR #1213 to address the code duplication.

take another look.
